results.title: The Cutting edge: Australia's Operational Deployment Force in action
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner and Stafford Garner and Associates
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Orange land forces invaded central Queensland to sabotage Australia’s coal export industry. To counter the threat, the Townsville-based Operational Deployment Force (the cutting edge of the Australian Army) was deployed against them. For the first time, the combat capabilities of the Operational Development Force was being tested. “Jordo” (Private Paul Jordan) was part of the Force assigned to defend our local resources. The Army cameras went into battle with “Jordo” and his platoon.
results.title_for_label: The Cutting edge: Australia’s Operational Deployment Force in action

results.title: Here's to your health: alcohol
results.creator_credit: Craig Reardon, Robert Grant and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: A program which aims to reduce alcohol consumption by addressing social and cultural aspects which influence teenagers to drink. The program also promotes some alcohol-free activities in the community.

results.title: Supermab
results.brief_description: A mathematics program which uses a humorous approach to revise place value concepts, substraction with regrouping and substraction with a zero difficulty. No other credits available.

results.title: Seeing a sound
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Jane Passy, a speech therapist, explains how valuable her system of cued articulation can be in primary education in helping children to learn the consonant sounds of the English language. The method involves hand movements to demonstrate the physical actions of speech.
